data.title: GeoGuessr Best Guess
data.solution:
# Get information from photo.
info = input().split(":")

# Get number of candidates.
n = int(input())

# Create hashmap of int:string (Matches # : country name)
# Ignore if matches # already in hashmap. (Satisfy decision rule)
matching_information = {}
for i in range(n):
    country, *knowledge = input().split(":")
    matches = sum([1 for i in knowledge if i in info])
    if matches not in matching_information:
        matching_information[matches] = country

# Testing matches.
#    else:print(f"{country} with {matches} matches")
#print(matching_information)

# Print best guess otherwise 'No Guess'.
best_guess = max(matching_information.items())
if best_guess[0] != 0:
    print(best_guess[1])
else:
    print("No guess")
data.statement:
In NMPZ GeoGuessr, players analyse an image for clues such as road markings, domain names, vehicle licence plates, and other visual indicators.

The goal is to use those clues and knowledge of potential candidate countries to identify the [[best guess]]. The [[best guess]] is the country that contains the <<MOST>> matches of information observed in the image.

Information is separated by a {{:}} character. An individual piece of information is in the form: identifier{{-}}value (e.g. climate{{-}}warm). Candidate countries contain the country name as additional information at start of the string.

<<Tiebreaker Rules:>>
• If there are <<MORE THAN ONE>> country with the <<SAME>> number of matches of information, select the country that was seen <<FIRST>>.
• If <<NO MATCHING>> pairs exist, guess {{No guess}}

<<Example:>>
{{language-English}}:{{telephone-+44}}:road lines-yellow and white
2
Canada:{{language-English}}:telephone-+1
United Kingdom:{{telephone-+44}}:driving side-left:{{language-English}}

Canada has <<1>> match (language) whilst United Kingdom has <<2>> matches (language and telephone)
Therefore <<United Kingdom>> is the [[best guess]].

testCases.title: Two Countries
testCases.testIn:
front licence plate-white:language-English
2
Japan:driving side-left:bollard-white:front licence plate-white:rear licence plate-white:telephone-+81:language-Japanese
United Kingdom:domain-.co.uk:front licence plate-white:rear licence plate-yellow:language-English:driving side-left:telephone-+44

road lines-yellow and white:telephone-+1:language-English

data.stubGenerator:
read clues:string(256)
read n:int
loop n read information:string(256)
write country
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> String separated with {{:}} of [[clues]] from the image.
<<Line 2: >> Integer [[n]] representing the number of candidate countries.
<<Next [[n]] lines: >> String separated with {{:}} of [[information]] related to a candidate [[country]].
data.outputDescription: String representing the country providing the [[best guess]]. {{No guess}} if no matching information to any candidate country.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In NMPZ GeoGuessr, players analyse an image for clues such as road markings, domain names, vehicle licence plates, and other visual indicators.

The goal is to use those clues and knowledge of potential candidate countries to identify the best guess. The best guess is the country that contains the MOST matches of information observed in the image.

Information is separated by a : character. An individual piece of information is in the form: identifier-value (e.g. climate-warm). Candidate countries contain the country name as additional information at start of the string.

Tiebreaker Rules:
• If there are MORE THAN ONE country with the SAME number of matches of information, select the country that was seen FIRST.
• If NO MATCHING pairs exist, guess No guess

Example:
language-English:telephone-+44:road lines-yellow and white
2
Canada:language-English:telephone-+1
United Kingdom:telephone-+44:driving side-left:language-English

Canada has 1 match (language) whilst United Kingdom has 2 matches (language and telephone)
Therefore United Kingdom is the best guess.
Input
Line 1: String separated with : of clues from the image.
Line 2: Integer n representing the number of candidate countries.
Next n lines: String separated with : of information related to a candidate country.
Output
String representing the country providing the best guess. No guess if no matching information to any candidate country.
Constraints
1 ≤ n ≤ 10
Example
Input
front licence plate-white:language-English
2
Japan:driving side-left:bollard-white:front licence plate-white:rear licence plate-white:telephone-+81:language-Japanese
United Kingdom:domain-.co.uk:front licence plate-white:rear licence plate-yellow:language-English:driving side-left:telephone-+44
Output
United Kingdom
